get: Inorrect, as this is the authorisation code flow we need to POST to get the authorisation code.
post: Correct! As this is the authorisation code flow we require POSTing our auth request to the /authorize endpoint.
scopes: Correct! We simply require the 'oidc' scope to authenticate the user via OIDC.
redirect_uri: Correct! Upon the authorisation server authenticating the user successfully, we need to send the authorization code to the redirect URI inputted.
auth_endpoint: Correct! As this is the authorisation code flow we need to request the authorisation code from the /authorize endpoint, which we can then use to get our access token.
token_endpoint: Correct! As we have the authorisation code we need to call the /token endpoint with this value to receive our access token.
client_id: Correct! All requests to the /authorize endpoint mandate a client ID being passed.
client_secret: Correct! As the request to /token is coming from our backend service, we require sending a client secret to provide authentication to the authorisation server, allowing us to receive the access token.
token_response_type: Incorrect, as this is the authorisation code flow we must specify a response type of 'code' to receive the authorisation code.
code_response_type: Correct! With the authorisation code flow, we require the /authorize endpoint to provision us an authorisation code, which we can trade for an access token later.
